TopicTitle: Making an 8-wheeled, manned rover: I need help with shapes

Articles.Content:
Alright, so here's the skinny: I built a (massive) kethane drilling platform that I named the SP1DR MDP (yes, I got the naming conventions from Borderlands 2). The problem is, it only has 6 wheels, thereby invalidating the name, and also, it tends to tip forward with sudden stops. So I build a base with 8 attachment points for wheels. Unfortunatly, the pod wasn't in the center of the frame, and when I tried to move it, I found out that there's issues with moving your attachment point (big thanks to astropapi1 for pointing that out to me). So I turn to those who are smarter than me (hopefully), to help me figure out a shape that can keep the cockpit in the center of the frame, but still have 4 axles. Also, it needs to be drivable and stable. Here's my failed frame:

Notice how badly off-center the cockpit is. Also, for your information, I'm going to be using the Rovermax Model 3 wheels (The huge ones), so it'll have tank steering rather than standard.

So, help me find shapes. Pretty please?

Just to see if I could I tackled your problem and lo and behold, I solved it ... only, how do you actually attach those big rover wheels to the "axles"? I can attach the wheels to the sides of the girders, but they won't attach to the little structural blocks!
Just do the same thing you do with spaceplane building.. Turn on the center of mass marker and make sure it's in between your two sets of the inside wheels.

I slap on the Rovemate one the axles, then I use them as an attachment point. With that out of the way, how'd you solve the problem?

I'm glad I could help you!

Are you going for a totally stock truck? Because the modular omniwheels mod has different wheels you can use. Scott Manley used them on his RSS series.
